metadata.title: CVE-2024-40902 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:jfs: xattr: fix buffer overflow for invalid xattrWhen an xattr size is not what is expected, it is printed out to thekernel log in hex format as a form of debugging.  But when that xattrsize is bigger than the expected size, printing it out can cause anaccess off the end of the buffer.Fix this all up by properly restricting the size of the debug hex dumpin the kernel log.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-40902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-lowlatency - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-aws - 4.4.0-1136.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.142').
linux-azure package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1181.196~14.04.1').
